result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R. Sulzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: Heather.
Case called: 8:17 a.m.
INCLUDES: 20CF497, 22CF515.
State of WI appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears in custody and with Attorney Peter Rotter.
Date and time set for sentencing after revocation in 20CF497 and a plea hearing on 22CF515.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

22CF515;
State moves to;
CT 1>>DRI.
COURT grants above;
PLEA: 
CT 2 (Possess Firearm - Convicted of a Felony - Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 4 years in WSPS - 1 year 6 months of initial confinement, 2 years 6 months of E.S. - to run concurrent with any/all sentences.; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and follow up; Maintain absolute sobriety and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances, unless prescribed and taken as prescribed; No possession of dangerous weapons; CC plus DNA surcharge; DNA sample; CIP/SAP; 114 days jail credit.  

20CF497:

>>Parties make argument on sentencing recommendation.

COURT ORDERS: CT 1: 12 months in MCJ - to run concurrent with any/all sentences; any unpaid financials to be converted to a civil judgment; 114 days jail credit.

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. - Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
